availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William S. Stevens (Graves County, Kentucky, farmer and provisional government )

body.p: Graves County, Kentucky, farmer and provisional government convention member. Kentucky native. Married to Milency Stevens. Father of Virginia Stevens, Sallie Stevens, and Milton Stevens. Farmer n Graves County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Graves County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, p. 96.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, p. 1 of 35 and 35 of 35 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "William S. Stevens (Aug. 11,1822-Feb. 4, 1894)," Memorial #6935833, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6935833 (accessed April 16, 2020).
KYR-0004-033-0001
